name: ugliness
content:
ugliness noun [U]
(UNATTRACTIVENESS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being unpleasant to look at, or not attractive: the ugliness of the buildings He makes comedy out of his ugliness.
More examplesFewer examplesThe captain's wife, a woman of the most extreme ugliness, smiled toothlessly at me.There is a campaign to cleanse the campus of architectural ugliness by tearing down buildings.Whoever built the houses had insisted on uniformity, if not downright ugliness.

ugliness noun [U]
(VIOLENCE)
the quality of being unpleasant and threatening or violent: Some activists are dismayed by the occasional ugliness of the debate. The revelation of abuse of prisoners displayed an ugliness to the war that shook even those who supported it. See
ugly
More examplesFewer examplesAre we trying to hide the ugliness of the world from our children?The ugliness of the sentiments expressed by local people has taken some outsiders aback.There was no fight, there was no ugliness; he simply resigned.

(UNATTRACTIVE APPEARANCE)

(UNPLEASANTNESS)
